conclusion: Determine time for light to travel from O to AB boundary with refractive index sqrt(2).
Light travels from O to AB boundary; angle of incidence is 45 degrees.
Use Snell's Law to find angle of refraction.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2).
Path length L is hypotenuse of right triangle with height h and horizontal distance d.
Since angle of incidence is 45 degrees, h = d.
Calculate path length L = h sqrt(2).
Speed of light in transparent body: v = c/n.
Calculate speed v = 1.5 x 10^8 sqrt(2) m/s.
Calculate time t = L/v = h/(1.5 x 10^8).
Assume h = 1 meter, calculate t = 2/3 x 10^-8 seconds.
